Command.Name: ai
Command.Description: Have the source enemy use the internal AI system.

Command.Name: activePlayer
Command.Description: Set or get the active player, by handle.

Command.Name: addPlayer
Command.Description: Add a player to the party.

Command.Name: animatedTiles
Command.Description: Toogle animated tiles.

Command.Name: animation
Command.Description: Apply a status effect to a fighter.

Command.Name: appPath
Command.Description: Retrieve the path of the trans3.exe, without the final backslash.

Command.Name: applyStatus
Command.Description: Apply a status effect to a fighter.

Command.Name: asc
Command.Description: Get the ASCII value of a character.

Command.Name: attackAll
Command.Description: Deal the specified amount in HP to all the members of the target's party.

Command.Name: autoLocal
Command.Description: Set the default scope for variable resolution. When autolocal is enabled, variables are assumed to be local unless a global variable has been defined.

Command.Name: bitmap
Command.Description: Fill a surface with an image.

Command.Name: boardGetProgram
Command.Tooltip: void BoardGetProgram(int programIndex, string &program, int &pointCount, int &layer, bool &isClosed, int &attributes, int &distanceRepeat)
Command.Description: Returns the properties of a given program.

Command.Name: boardGetProgramPoint
Command.Tooltip: void BoardGetProgramPoint(int programIndex, int pointIndex, int &x, int &y)
Command.Description: Get a single point on a board program. X and Y are always pixel values.

Command.Name: boardGetVector
Command.Description: Returns the number of vectors on the board.

Command.Name: boardGetVectorPoint
Command.Description: Get a single point on a board vector. X and Y are always pixel values.

Command.Name: boardSetProgram
Command.Tooltip: void BoardSetProgram(int programIndex, string program, int pointCount, int layer, bool isClosed, int attributes, int distanceRepeat)
Command.Description: Sets the properties of a given program; creates a new program if one-past-the-end index is given.

Command.Name: boardSetProgramPoint
Command.Tooltip: void BoardSetProgramPoint(int programIndex, int pointIndex, int x, int y)
Command.Description: Set/move a single point on a board program. x, y are always pixel values.

Command.Name: boardSetVector
Command.Tooltip: void boardSetVector(variant vector, int type, int pointCount, int layer, bool isClosed, int attributes)
Command.Description: Sets the properties of a given vector. Creates a new vector if an existing one is not found - if a numeric variable is supplied, it will be set to the new index (one-past-end).

Command.Name: boardSetVectorPoint
Command.Tooltip: void BoardSetVectorPoint(variant vector, int pointIndex, int x, int y, bool apply)
Command.Description: Set/move a single point on a board vector. x, y are always pixel values. Set apply = true for last change, to improve speed.

Command.Name: bold
Command.Description: Toggle emboldening of text.

Command.Name: branch
Command.Description: Jump to a label.

Command.Name: callShop
Command.Tooltip: void CallShop(string item1, string item2, string item3, ...)
Command.Description: Displays a basic shop interface that allows the buying of the items given as parameters and the selling of items in the player's inventory.

Command.Name: canvasDrawPart
Command.Tooltip: void CanvasDrawPart(int cnv, int x, int y, int xSrc, int ySrc, int width, int height[, canvas cnvDest])
Command.Description: Draw part of a canvas.

Command.Name: canvasGetScreen
Command.Description: Copy the screen onto a canvas.

Command.Name: castInt
Command.Description: Cast the specified value to an integer (i.e., a number in the sequence ...-2, -1, 0, 1, 2...). This is useful for removing fractional parts of numbers. Note that this function does not round.

Command.Name: castLit
Command.Description: Cast the specified value to a string. There is really no need to do this ever. RPGCode by itself will cast values passed to functions to the correct types as required.

Command.Name: castNum
Command.Description: Cast the specified value to a number (double). There is really no need to do this ever. RPGCode by itself will cast values passed to functions to the correct types as required.

Command.Name: change
Command.Description: Change this program so that next time it is triggered, a different program runs instead. Change() is active only while the player remains on the board (i.e., leaving the board causes programs to return to normal).

Command.Name: charAt
Command.Description: Get a character from a string. The first character is one. The value of the pos parameter must be in the closed interval [1, length].

Command.Name: chr
Command.Description: Get the character represented by the ASCII code passed in.

Command.Name: clear
Command.Description: Clear a surface. clear() blanks the screen. clear(cnv) blanks the canvas whose handle is 'cnv'.

Command.Name: clearBuffer
Command.Description: Clear the keyboard buffer.

Command.Name: clearButtons
Command.Description: Clear buttons set by SetButton(). Clear specific slot(s) if supplied, else clear all slots.

Command.Name: closeFile
Command.Description: Close a file.

Command.Name: color
Command.Description: Change to a DOS colour.

Command.Name: colorRGB
Command.Tooltip: void colorRGB(int r, int g, int b)
Command.Description: Change the active colour to an RGB value.

Command.Name: cos
Command.Description: Calculate cosine x.

Command.Name: createCanvas
Command.Description: Create a canvas.

Command.Name: createCursorMap
Command.Description: Create a cursor map.

Command.Name: createItem
Command.Description: Load an item and return the slot into which it was loaded.

Command.Name: cursorMapAdd
Command.Tooltip: void CursorMapAdd(int x, int y, cursor_map map)
Command.Description: Add a point to a cursor map.

Command.Name: cursorMapHand
Command.Tooltip: void CursorMapHand(string cursor[, bool stretch = true])
Command.Description:
Change the cursor used everywhere cursors are used (e.g. cursor maps, the menu, the battle system), optionally not stretching it to 32 by 32 pixels.
The string "default" restores the default image.

Command.Name: cursorMapRun
Command.Description: Run a cursor map.

Command.Name: debug
Command.Description: Toggle whether to show debug messages.

Command.Name: debugger
Command.Description: Show a debug message.

Command.Name: delay
Command.Description: Delay for a certain number of seconds.

Command.Name: destroyItem
Command.Description: Remove an item from memory. Warning: do not destroy an item through it's own multitasking thread.

Command.Name: destroyPlayer
Command.Description: Permanently remove a player from the party.

Command.Name: dirSav
Command.Tooltip: string DirSav(string title, bool allowNewFile, int textColor, int backColor, string image)
Command.Description: Allow the user to choose a *.sav file from the "Saved" directory. For historical reasons, returns "CANCEL" if no file is chosen, not "".

Command.Name: done
Command.Description: End the program.

Command.Name: dos
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: drainAll
Command.Description: Deal the specified amount in SMP to all the members of the target's party.

Command.Name: drawCanvas
Command.Tooltip: void DrawCanvas(canvas cnv, int x, int y, [int width, int height, [canvas dest]])
Command.Description: Blit a canvas forward.

Command.Name: drawCanvasTransparent
Command.Tooltip: void DrawCanvasTransparent(canvas cnv, int x, int y, int r, int g, int b[, int width, int height[, canvas dest]])
Command.Description: Blit a canvas forward, but don't blit one colour (the transparent colour).

Command.Name: drawCircle
Command.Tooltip: void DrawCircle(int x, int y, int radius [, int canvas])
Command.Description: Draw a circle at x,y, optionally to a canvas. Previously an arc could be defined but this never worked, so the two parameters have been cut and the optional canvas is now the fourth parameter.

Command.Name: drawEnemy
Command.Tooltip: void DrawEnemy(string file, int x, int y, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Draw an enemy.

Command.Name: drawLine
Command.Tooltip: void DrawLine(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, [canvas cnv])Draw a line.
Command.Description: Draw a line.

Command.Name: drawRect
Command.Tooltip: void DrawRect(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Draw a rectangle.

Command.Name: drianAll
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: earthquake
Command.Description: Shake the screen.

Command.Name: empty
Command.Description: Cleare all globals.

Command.Name: end
Command.Description: End the program.

Command.Name: endAnimation
Command.Description: End a multitasking animation.

Command.Name: equip
Command.Tooltip: void Equip(variant handle, int location, string item)
Command.Description: Equip an item from the inventory (by handle or filename) to a location on the player's body.

Command.Name: eraseItem
Command.Description: Erase an item from the screen, but keep it in memory. Warning: erasing an item in it's own multitasking thread will pause the thread.

Command.Name: erasePlayer
Command.Description: Erase a party player from the screen.

Command.Name: fade
Command.Description: Perform a fade using the current colour. There are several different types of fades.

Command.Name: fight
Command.Description: Start a skill level fight.

Command.Name: fightEnemy
Command.Tooltip: void FightEnemy(string enemy, string enemy, ... string background)
Command.Description: Start a fight.

Command.Name: fightMenuGraphic
Command.Description: Choose an image for the fight menu graphic.

Command.Name: fileEoF
Command.Description: Check whether the end of a file has been reached.

Command.Name: fileGet
Command.Description: Get a byte from a file.

Command.Name: fileInput
Command.Description: Read a line from a line.

Command.Name: filePrint
Command.Description: Write a line to a file.

Command.Name: filePut
Command.Description: Write a byte to a file.

Command.Name: fillCircle
Command.Tooltip: void FillCircle(int x, int y, int radius [, int canvas])
Command.Description: Draw a filled circle at x, y, to screen or canvas.

Command.Name: fillRect
Command.Tooltip: void FillRect(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Draw a filled rectangle.

Command.Name: font
Command.Description: Load a true type font.

Command.Name: fontSize
Command.Description: Set the font size.

Command.Name: forceReDraw
Command.Description: Force a redrawing of the screen.

Command.Name: gameSpeed
Command.Description: Set the overall walking speed. Changes the walking speed proportionally. +ve values increase speed, -ve decrease, by a factor of 10% per increment. Allowed values range from -MAX_GAMESPEED to +MAX_GAMESPEED.

Command.Name: get
Command.Description: Get a key from the queue.

Command.Name: getBoardName
Command.Description: Get the current board's file name.

Command.Name: getBoardTile
Command.Tooltip: string GetBoardTile(int x, int y, int z, [string &ret])
Command.Description: Get the file name of the tile at x, y, z.

Command.Name: getBoardTileType
Command.Tooltip: string GetBoardTileType(int x, int y, int z[, string &ret])
Command.Description: Get the type of a tile.

Command.Name: getColor
Command.Description: Get the current colour.

Command.Name: getCorner
Command.Description: Get the corner of the currently shown portion of the board.

Command.Name: getDp
Command.Description: Get a fighter's dp.

Command.Name: getFp
Command.Description: Get a fighter's fp.

Command.Name: getFontSize
Command.Description: Get the current font size.

Command.Name: getGp
Command.Description: Return the amount of gold pieces held.

Command.Name: getHp
Command.Description: Get a fighter's hp.

Command.Name: getItemCost
Command.Description: Get an item's cost.

Command.Name: getItemDesc
Command.Description: Get an item's description.

Command.Name: getItemName
Command.Description: Get an item's handle.

Command.Name: getItemSellPrice
Command.Description: Get the price for which an item sells.

Command.Name: getLevel
Command.Description: Get the level of a player.

Command.Name: getMaxHp
Command.Description: Get a fighter's max hp.

Command.Name: getMaxSmp
Command.Description: Get a fighter's max smp.

Command.Name: getPixel
Command.Tooltip: void GetPixel(int x, int y, int &r, int &g, int &b, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Get the colour of the pixel at (x, y).

Command.Name: getRes
Command.Description: Get the screen's resolution.

Command.Name: getSmp
Command.Description: Get a fighter's smp.

Command.Name: getTextHeight
Command.Description: Get the height of a string of text in pixels, relative to the current font and size.

Command.Name: getTextWidth
Command.Description: Get the width of a string of text in pixels, relative to the current font and size.

Command.Name: getThreadId
Command.Description: Get the ID of this thread.

Command.Name: getTickCount
Command.Description: Get the number of milliseconds since Windows started.

Command.Name: giveExp
Command.Description: Give experience to a player.

Command.Name: giveGp
Command.Description: Give gold pieces.

Command.Name: giveHp
Command.Description: Increase a fighter's current hp.

Command.Name: giveItem
Command.Description: Add an item to the inventory.

Command.Name: giveSmp
Command.Description: Increase a fighter's smp.

Command.Name: global
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: gone
Command.Description: Remove the currently running program from the board until the board has been left.

Command.Name: hp
Command.Description: Set a fighter's hp.

Command.Name: inStr
Command.Tooltip: int InStr(string haystack, string needle[, int offset])
Command.Description: Returns the first occurence of needle within haystack, optionally starting from an offset. Both the return value and the offset are one-based.

Command.Name: inn
Command.Description: Fully heal the player party.

Command.Name: internalMenu
Command.Description: Show a menu using the menu plugin.

Command.Name: italics
Command.Description: Toggle italicizing of text.

Command.Name: itemCount
Command.Description: Count the number of a certain item in the inventory.

Command.Name: itemDirection
Command.Description: Returns the item direction.

Command.Name: itemGetPath
Command.Description: Get the number of points in the sprite's path.

Command.Name: itemLocation
Command.Tooltip: void ItemLocation(variant handle, int &x, int &y, int &layer)
Command.Description: Get the location of an item.

Command.Name: itemPath
Command.Tooltip: void ItemPath(variant handle, int flags, int x1, int y1, ... , int xn, int yn)
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: itemSpeed
Command.Description: Set the delay in seconds between an item's steps.

Command.Name: itemStance
Command.Tooltip: void ItemStance(handle item, string stance [, int flags])
Command.Description: Animate an item's custom stance.

Command.Name: itemStep
Command.Tooltip: void ItemStep(variant handle, int x, int y [, int flags])
Command.Description: Causes the item to take one step in the direction of x, y following a route determined by pathFind.

Command.Name: kill
Command.Description: Delete variables.

Command.Name: killCanvas
Command.Description: Kill a canvas.

Command.Name: killCursorMap
Command.Description: Kill a cursor map.

Command.Name: killThread
Command.Description: Kill a thread.

Command.Name: lCase
Command.Description: Convert a string to lowercase.

Command.Name: layerPut
Command.Tooltip: void LayerPut(int x, int y, int layer, string tile)
Command.Description: Place a tile on the board for the duration the player is on the board.

Command.Name: left
Command.Tooltip: string Left(string str, int amount[, string &ret])
Command.Description: Get characters from the left of a string.

Command.Name: len
Command.Description: Get the length of a string.

Command.Name: load
Command.Description: Load the game state from a file.

Command.Name: local
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: log
Command.Description: Returns n such that en = x.

Command.Name: mp3Pause
Command.Description: Play a sound effect and pause the engine until it finishes.

Command.Name: mwin
Command.Description: Displays a message in a dialog box.

Command.Name: mwinCls
Command.Description: Clear and hide the message window.

Command.Name: mainFile
Command.Description: Load a new main file.

Command.Name: maxHp
Command.Description: Set a fighter's max hp.

Command.Name: maxSmp
Command.Description: Set a fighter's max smp.

Command.Name: mediaPlay
Command.Description: Play the specified file as the background music.

Command.Name: mediaStop
Command.Description: Stop the background music.

Command.Name: menuGraphic
Command.Description: Choose an image for the menu.

Command.Name: mid
Command.Tooltip: string Mid(string str, int start, int length[, string &dest])
Command.Description: Obtain a substring. The offset is one-based.

Command.Name: mouseClick
Command.Description: Wait for a mouseclick or immediately retrieve the last and return the x, y location (pixel values relative to the window).

Command.Name: mouseCursor
Command.Tooltip: void MouseCursor(string file, int x, int y, int red, int green. int blue)
Command.Description: Change the mouse cursor. "TK DEFAULT" or "" restores the default cursor.

Command.Name: mouseMove
Command.Description: Wait for the mouse to move and return the x,y location in pixels from the window corner.

Command.Name: mousePointer
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: move
Command.Tooltip: void Move(int x, int y, [int z = 1])
Command.Description: Move this board program to a new location on the board. The effect lasts until the board has been left.

Command.Name: msgBox
Command.Tooltip: int MsgBox(string text [,string title [, int style [, int textColor [, int backColor [, string bitmap]]]]])
Command.Description: Display a message box containing one or two buttons, handled using a cursor map (keyboard input only). The background is drawn translucently using the MWin() translucency value. Any background image supplied is stretched to the size of the box.

Command.Name: multirun
Command.Description: Multirun()'s behaviour depends on the program's context. In a thread: No action. In a program (non-thread): All sprite movements called are queued up and movement begins after the closing brace of the function, thereby allowing simultaneous movement. Previously occurring movements are cleared.

Command.Name: newPlayer
Command.Description: Change the graphics of the main player to that of the file passed in. The file must be a character file (*.tem)

Command.Name: onBoard
Command.Description: Return whether a player is being shown on the board.

Command.Name: openFileAppend
Command.Description: Open a file for appending.

Command.Name: openFileInput
Command.Description: Open a file in input mode.

Command.Name: openFileOutput
Command.Description: Open a file in output mode.

Command.Name: over
Command.Description: Displays a game over message and resets the game. Because you can (and should) set a game over program, this function is pointless.

Command.Name: pathFind
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: pixelMovement
Command.Description: Toggles pixel movement and push() et al. in pixels. Returns whether pixel movement is being used. pixelPush is ineffective for tile movement.

Command.Name: pixelText
Command.Tooltip: void PixelText(int x, int y, string str, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Displays text on the screen using pixel coordinates.

Command.Name: playAvi
Command.Description: Play a movie full screen. Supported types are *.avi, *.mpg, and *.mov.

Command.Name: playAviSmall
Command.Description: Play a movie at actual size, centred. Supported types are *.avi, *.mpg, and *.mov.

Command.Name: playMidi
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: playerDirection
Command.Description: Returns the player direction.

Command.Name: playerGetPath
Command.Description: Get the number of points in the sprite's path.

Command.Name: playerLocation
Command.Tooltip: void PlayerLocation(variant handle, int &x, int &y, int &layer)
Command.Description: Get the location of a player.

Command.Name: playerPath
Command.Tooltip: void PlayerPath(variant handle, int flags, int x1, int y1, ... , int xn, int yn)
Command.Description: Sprite walks the explicit path given by x1, y1 to xn, yn. Required flag: none.

Command.Name: playerSpeed
Command.Description: Set the delay in seconds between a player's steps.

Command.Name: playerStance
Command.Tooltip: void PlayerStance(handle player, string stance [, int flags])
Command.Description:
Animate a player's custom stance.
Possible flags tkMV_PAUSE_THREAD: Hold thread execution until animation ends

Command.Name: playerStep
Command.Tooltip: void PlayerStep(variant handle, int x, int y [, int flags])
Command.Description: Causes the player to take one step in the direction of x, y following a route determined by pathFind.

Command.Name: posture
Command.Description: Show a custom player animation named "Custom" + str(id) (e.g. "Custom1") This command is obsolete - use playerStance() instead.

Command.Name: prg
Command.Tooltip: void Prg(string program. int x, int y, [int z = 1])
Command.Description: Move a program on the current board to a new location. This stays in effect until the board is left.

Command.Name: print
Command.Description: Write the specified string one line down from the last call to text().

Command.Name: prompt
Command.Description: Ask the player a question and return the result.

Command.Name: push
Command.Tooltip: void Push(string direction [, variant handle [, int flags]])
Command.Description: Push the player with the specified handle, or the default player if no handle is specified, along the given directions. The direction should be a comma delimited, but if it is not, it will be delimited for backward compatibility.

Command.Name: pushItem
Command.Tooltip: void PushItem(variant item, string direction [, int flags])
Command.Description: The first parameter accepts either a string that can be either "target" or "source" direction or the number of an item. The syntax of the directional string is the same as for [[push()]].

Command.Name: put
Command.Tooltip: void Put(int x, int y, string tile)
Command.Description: Puts a tile at the specified location on the board. The tile persists only until the program ends. Use LayerPut() to place a tile for the duration the user is on the board. x and y are specified in tile coordinates.

Command.Name: putItem
Command.Tooltip: void PutItem(variant handle, int x, int y, int layer)
Command.Description: Place the item on the board at the given location.

Command.Name: putPlayer
Command.Tooltip: void PutPlayer(string handle, int x, int y, int layer)
Command.Description: Place the player on the board at the given location.

Command.Name: rpgCode
Command.Description: Independently run a line of RPGCode.

Command.Name: random
Command.Description: Generate a random number from one to the supplied maximum, inclusive.

Command.Name: regExpReplace
Command.Tooltip: string RegExpReplace(string subject, string pattern, string replace)
Command.Description: Replace using a regular expression.

Command.Name: remove
Command.Description: Remove an equipped item and return it to the inventory.

Command.Name: removePlayer
Command.Description: Remove a player from the party [to an old player list].

Command.Name: removeStatus
Command.Description: Remove a status effect from a fighter.

Command.Name: renderNow
Command.Description: Controls rendering of the cnvRenderNow reserved canvas. The canvas is drawn every frame above all board elements (e.g. tiles, sprites, animations). Access the canvas by passing 'cnvRenderNow' to the drawing functions. Do not call CreateCanvas() or KillCanvas() on cnvRenderNow.

Command.Name: replace
Command.Tooltip: string Replace(string str, string find, string replace[, string &dest])
Command.Description: Replace within a string.

Command.Name: reset
Command.Description: Reset the game.

Command.Name: restorePlayer
Command.Description: Restore a player who was previously on the team.

Command.Name: restoreScreen
Command.Tooltip: void RestoreScreen([int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int xdest, int ydest])
Command.Description: Draw a buffered screen capture to the screen. The canvas drawn is the first in the screen array. x1, x2 specify the bottom- right corner of the screen, so that width = x2 - x1, etc.

Command.Name: restoreScreenArray
Command.Tooltip: void RestoreScreenArray(int pos [,int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int xdest, int ydest])
Command.Description: Draw a buffered screen capture to the screen. x1, x2 specify the bottom-right corner of the screen, so that width = x2 - x1, etc.

Command.Name: resume Next
Command.Description: Return to the statement after the statement where an error occurred.

Command.Name: right
Command.Description: Get characters from the right of a string.

Command.Name: run
Command.Description: Transfer control to a different program.

Command.Name: smp
Command.Description: Set a fighter's smp.

Command.Name: save
Command.Description: Save the current game state to a file.

Command.Name: saveScreen
Command.Description: Save the current screen onto a canvas that can be restored at a later time.

Command.Name: send
Command.Tooltip: void Send(string file, int x, int y, [int z = 1])
Command.Description: Send the player to a new board.

Command.Name: setAmbientLevel
Command.Tooltip: void SetAmbientLevel(int red, int green, int blue)
Command.Description: Set the global ambient level. Valid values range from -255 to + 255.

Command.Name: setButton
Command.Tooltip: void SetButton(string file, int slot, int x, int y, int width, int height)
Command.Description: Create and draw a clickable button at screen pixel co-ords x, y that persists until clearButtons() is called.

Command.Name: setConstants
Command.Description: Description.

Command.Name: setErrorHandler
Command.Description: Set an error handler for the current function. This does not propagate up the call stack! Refer to the language features section of the manual for more information.

Command.Name: setImage
Command.Tooltip: void SetImage(string str, int x, int y, int width, int height, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Set an image.

Command.Name: setImageAddictive
Command.Tooltip: void SetImageAdditive(string file, int x, int y, int width, int height, double percent[, canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Set an image with a tint of the specified percent.

Command.Name: setImageTransparent
Command.Tooltip: void SetImageTransparent(string file, int x, int y, int width, int height, int r, int g, int b, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Set an image with a transparent colour.

Command.Name: setImageTransulcent
Command.Tooltip: void SetImageTranslucent(string file, int x, int y, int width, int height, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Set an image translucently.

Command.Name: setMwinTranslucency
Command.Description: Set the translucency of the message window. 0% is invisible; 100% is opaque.

Command.Name: setPixel
Command.Tooltip: void SetPixel(int x, int y, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Set a pixel in the current colour.

Command.Name: setResumeNextHandler
Command.Description: Cause errors in the current function to be silently ignored. This does not propagate up the call stack!

Command.Name: setVolume
Command.Description: Set the volume of all music and sound using a value between 0 and 100.

Command.Name: show
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: sin
Command.Description: Calculate sine x.

Command.Name: sizedAnimation
Command.Description: Content to be written...

Command.Name: smartStep
Command.Description: Toggle "smart" stepping.

Command.Name: sourceHandle
Command.Description: Get the handle of the source object.

Command.Name: sourceLocation
Command.Description: Get the location of the source object.

Command.Name: spliceVariables
Command.Description: Replaces substrings within angle brackets by the value of variables with respective names, e.g. "<x>" would be replaced by the value of "x".

Command.Name: split
Command.Tooltip: int Split(string str, string delimiter, array arr)
Command.Description: Splits a string at a delimiter. Returns the number of upper bound of the array (i.e. the index of the last set element).

Command.Name: spriteTranslucency
Command.Description: Set the degree to which sprites drawn underneath other objects are visible. Specify a value between 0 (invisible) and 100 (opaque).

Command.Name: sqrt
Command.Description: Calculate the square root of x.

Command.Name: stance
Command.Description: Show a player stance. This command is obsolete - use playerStance() instead.

Command.Name: start
Command.Description: Open a file with the shell.

Command.Name: takeGp
Command.Description: Take gold pieces.

Command.Name: takeItem
Command.Description: Remove an item from the inventory.

Command.Name: tan
Command.Description: Calculate tangent x.

Command.Name: targetHandle
Command.Description: Get the handle of the target object.

Command.Name: targetLocation
Command.Description: Get the location of the target object.

Command.Name: tellThread
Command.Description: Execute code in the context of a thread (e.g., to run a method located in another thread). TellThread() returns the value returned by the function called in the thread.

Command.Name: text
Command.Tooltip: void Text(double x, double y, string str, [canvas cnv])
Command.Description: Displays text on the screen.

Command.Name: thread
Command.Description: Start a thread.

Command.Name: threadSleep
Command.Description: Put a thread to sleep.

Command.Name: threadSleepRemaining
Command.Description: Check how much sleep remains for a thread.

Command.Name: threadWake
Command.Description: Wake up a thread.

Command.Name: tileType
Command.Tooltip: void TileType(int x, int y, string type, [int z = 1])
Command.Description: Change a tile's type. Valid types for the string parameter are "NORMAL", "SOLID", "UNDER", "NS", "EW", "STAIRS#". Do not use when using vectors - use vector tools instead.

Command.Name: trim
Command.Description: Trim whitespace from a string.

Command.Name: ucase
Command.Description: Convert a string to uppercase.

Command.Name: underArrow
Command.Description: Toggle the under arrow.

Command.Name: underLine
Command.Description: Toggle underlining of text.

Command.Name: viewBrd
Command.Tooltip: void ViewBrd(string filename [, int x, int y [, canvas cnv]])
Command.Description: Draw a board to the screen or to a canvas, starting at co-ordinates topX, topY.

Command.Name: wait
Command.Description: Wait for a key to be pressed, and return the key that was.

Command.Name: wander
Command.Description: The first parameter accepts either a string that can be either "target" or "source" or the number of an item. The selected item will take a step in a random direction, or as restricted by the optional parameter.

Command.Name: wav
Command.Description: Play a wave file (e.g. a sound effect).

Command.Name: wavStop
Command.Description: Stop the current sound effect.

Command.Name: winColor
Command.Description: Set the message window's colour using a DOS code.

Command.Name: winColorRgb
Command.Tooltip: void WinColorRGB(int r, int g, int b)
Command.Description: Set the message window's colour.

Command.Name: winGraphic
Command.Description: Set the message window background image.

Command.Name: windows
Command.Description: Exit to windows.

Command.Name: wipe
Command.Tooltip: void Wipe(string file, int effect [, int speed])
Command.Description: Wipe' a graphic to the screen.

Command.Name: zoom
Command.Description: Zoom into the centre of the board by the specified percent.
